page.title: 10Foote Farm, Georgeham
page.content: The farmer at Foote Farm has got 80 acres of land and he has got a dairy herd.He has got 25 British Friesians and 90 breeding ewes that produce about 120 lambs.Mr Norman used to milk his cows by hand 30 years ago.There is a farmers saying, sheer your sheep in June, sheer your lambs in July.A sheepdog is essential to gather up the sheep.Mr Norman has lived on the farm 53 years and his favourite animals are the Friesian cow and the sheep.He grows 5 acres of oats,5 acres of barley and 2 acres of fodderbeet.Mr Norman likes the farm because it is interesting and he likes to be in the fresh air all the time.The type of sheepdog he has got is a collie called Bonzo. Forty years ago their were no tractors there were only horses.
